intro: Hibbertia humifusa subsp. erigens, commonly known as the erect hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically blooms from late winter to early spring, producing clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a rough, hairy texture, and it prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Hibbertia humifusa subsp. erigens is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in full sun.
